ticket.title: Flash convenience methods "notice" and "alert" should also be available for FlashNow
ticket.original-body:
Hi,
I guess the title describes it already pretty well. I think that for consistency, a FlashNow object should also have the same convenience methods as a Flash object has. In my mind a FlashNow object is the same as a Flash object, only that it isn't around for the next action, but has the same behavior.
So instead of
@@@ Flash.notice = "Saved" Flash.now[:notice] = "Saved" @@@
I can write
@@@ Flash.notice = "Saved" Flash.now.notice = "Saved" @@@

So instead of
@@@ Flash.notice = "Saved" Flash.now[:notice] = "Saved" @@@
I can write
@@@ Flash.notice = "Saved" Flash.now.notice = "Saved" @@@
ticket.original-body-html:
Hi,

I guess the title describes it already pretty well. I think that for consistency, a FlashNow object should also have the same convenience methods as a Flash object has. In my mind a FlashNow object is the same as a Flash object, only that it isn't around for the next action, but has the same behavior.

So instead of

Flash.notice = "Saved"
Flash.now[:notice] = "Saved"

I can write

Flash.notice = "Saved"
Flash.now.notice = "Saved"

version.body-html:
Hi,

I guess the title describes it already pretty well. I think that for consistency, a FlashNow object should also have the same convenience methods as a Flash object has. In my mind a FlashNow object is the same as a Flash object, only that it isn't around for the next action, but has the same behavior.

So instead of

Flash.notice = "Saved"
Flash.now[:notice] = "Saved"

I can write

version.title: Flash convenience methods "notice" and "alert" should also be available for FlashNow

version.body:
I like the idea and created a patch to add that behaviour.
I added:
flash.now.alert=(message) flash.now.notice=(message)
It's my first patch I ever created for the rails source, so if I did anything wrong, please tell me.
version.body-html:
I like the idea and created a patch to add that behaviour.

I added:

flash.now.alert=(message)
flash.now.notice=(message)

It's my first patch I ever created for the rails source, so if I did anything wrong, please tell me.

version.body: just wanted to upload patch for ticket 4369 and recognized that there is already an applied patch. But the patch doesn't include all accessors from the original flash and is also a little unDRY so I am attaching my patch nevertheless.

version.title: Flash convenience methods "notice" and "alert" should also be available for FlashNow
Flash convenience methods "notice" and "alert" should also be available for FlashNow

version.body:
Michael's code looks better but the question is do we need getters for "flash.now.notice" and "flash.now.alert"?
You'll never use "flash.now.notice" in any view, you only use "flash.notice" and either it survived the last request or it didn't depending on whether you set it through flash or flash.now
but it might be helpful in a controller..
version.body-html:
Michael's code looks better but the question is do we need getters for "flash.now.notice" and "flash.now.alert"?

You'll never use "flash.now.notice" in any view, you only use "flash.notice" and either it survived the last request or it didn't depending on whether you set it through flash or flash.now

but it might be helpful in a controller..
version.title: Flash convenience methods "notice" and "alert" should also be available for FlashNow
